EXERCISEIII
MORE FALLACIES OF RELEVANCE
Questions like those used to evaluate appeals to authority can also be used
to assess some other common styles of reasoning that are often accused of
being fallacious. Here is one example:
The American people are convinced that, if we get involved in North
Korea, we will be stuck there for a long time. So we shouldn’t invade in
the first place.
